title: Portishead - Saturnine
description:
Portishead - Saturnine
Bootleg
Compiled in: 2008

1. Requiem For Anna (Un Jour Comme Un Autre - Anna) (2:39)
2. Key Bored (5:57)
3. Saturnine (3:51)
4. Waiting For... (5:25)
5. Greek Jam (2:03)


For all of you who are disappointed about the lack of B-sides from the Third sessions or about the initially-promised-but-not-delivered bonus track from the Japanese issue of Third, here&#039;s Saturnine. This is a bootleg comprimising the relatively few leaked songs from the period between the self-titled album and the actual Third sessions - and nothing more. No remixes (that&#039;s what Trip-Hop Reconstruction and Portishead Remixes vol. 1 & 2 are for) and no tagging stuff from Mandalay or Jane Birkin as Portishead (and no Beth Gibbons & Rustin Man stuff either). Just Portishead tracks. As a side note, this bootleg was titled not after the Saturnine song in it, but after the initial working title of Third. Don&#039;t know if they actually thought of naming their third album Saturnine (the teaser on YouTube is certainly fake, with a theme by another artist, not Poritshead), but Geoff did said that Saturnine and Waiting For... are merely old "doodles", which means though that they&#039;re genuine Portishead songs. Come to think of it, I would have prefered Third to be named Saturnine and sound like those two excellent songs...
Nevertheless, I hope you guys will enjoy my effort to compile these songs and put them in one place.

Side notes:

- Track 1 is taken from "Monsieur Gainsbourg Revisited" (check out that compilation, there&#039;s also a rare Tricky song on it), track 2 and 5 are from MySpace, while 3 and 4 are from the Saturnine leak on iSound.

- Track 1 is vocal (even though you might not recognize the voice, it&#039;s Beth Gibbons who is singing) while 2-5 are instrumental.

- Track 4 samples... erm, I don&#039;t know what it samples.

- Track 5 is actually one single loop (or a combination of loops). It will likely appeal to drone/dark ambient aficionados or to some of the fans of the most gloomy moments on Third.

- Back on MySpace, Key Bored and Greek Jam both had attached to them pics and album information bars. A pic that might be the logo of a security company (from Portishead?) and a line intriguinly called "big angry one... grr" was attached to Key Bored, while at Greek Jam the player said something like "our third album/2006 (or 2007?) island" - don&#039;t remember whole of it. Greek Jam&#039;s pic was apparently a screenshot from a very old computer game though.

- The cool avatar of their MySpace is from a Stanley Kubrick film. ;)
